item.title: Sevenhugs' Smart Remote
item.description:
Sevenhugs' Smart Remote

Looking to simplify the endless number of apps and interfaces used to control smart-home products, French start-up Sevenhugs has introduced the first "contextually aware" universal Smart Remote. In other words, it's the first remote to understand where it is in your home and what it's pointing at, allowing users to simply point and click to control devices instead of switching between apps.

item.title: Dogs and Peanut Butter: A Match Made in Photo Book Heaven
item.description:
Dogs and Peanut Butter: A Match Made in Photo Book Heaven

If you have a dog, you know the magic of the substance known as peanut butter-a small smudge on their nose and they'll be busy for the next 30 minutes. And now, animal photographer Greg Murray is capturing this magic in his photo book For the Love of Peanut Butter .

item.title: Food & Beer (Pre-order) | Food & Cookery | Phaidon Store
item.description:
Food & Beer (Pre-order) | Food & Cookery | Phaidon Store

The debut book by Danish gypsy brewer Jeppe Jarnit-Bjergsø of the bar Tørst, and Canadian chef Daniel Burns of the Michelin-starred restaurant Luksus-both in a shared space in Greenpoint, Brooklyn where they elevate beer to the level of wine in fine dining.

item.title: How to Book Better Airbnbs for Less Money
item.description:
How to Book Better Airbnbs for Less Money

How to successfully book your first-choice listings and get them for cheaper.

item.title: Paint With Fire Using This Virtual Reality App
item.description:
Paint With Fire Using This Virtual Reality App

Vocativ uses intelligent technology, smart journalists and the wisdom of the crowd to find story leads and angles no other news organization can.

item.title: A Clever Headrest That Could Make Flying Actually Bearable
item.description:
A Clever Headrest That Could Make Flying Actually Bearable

There are many reasons to hate flying economy. The tiny seats, the inedible food, the fees airlines charge for things you'd get for free in a medieval dungeon. Manon Kühne can't fix any of that, but she's has found one small way to make sitting in 17C just a bit less hellish.

item.title: Spotify's Design Lead on Why Side Projects Should Be Stupid
item.description:
Spotify's Design Lead on Why Side Projects Should Be Stupid

Tobias van Schneider lives his life like one big side project. Today, he designs and builds new products for Spotify in New York, but he couldn't have predicted that when he dropped out of school at age 15 to work as an apprentice in a computer shop in Austria.
